intro: Machaeranthera phyllocephala var. annua, commonly known as the annual goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its fibrous root system helps it survive in arid conditions, making it an important part of its ecosystem.
